Themes themes skins
PhotoPulse themes define how a show looks when it plays back. The theme defines the size of the show (width X height), additional decorations such as a backdrop image or photo frame borders, and the position and style of any photo captions in the show (see ).
You can preview a theme using the Full effect preview button in the Expert Panel. See for more information.
Theme Chooser
To select a theme for your show, click the Custom... button on the Settings Tab (see ). This will display the Theme Chooser.
Theme Chooser
Theme
Lists the available themes installed on your system. Selecting a theme in this list will display a description of the theme and will display a list of available photo sizes for this theme in the Photo size list.
The None theme is always available in the Theme list. It is a plain theme with no decorations, but it contains a variety of photo sizes for common photo orientations and aspect ratios.
Photo sizesize
Lists the available photo sizes for the selected theme. This is the size your photos will be displayed at - the actual show size itself might be larger due to theme decorations. The photo sizes that are recommended for the photos in your show are displayed normally. Photo sizes that are not a good match for your photos are displayed greyed out. These sizes can still be selected and used.
When the None theme is selected, the photo sizes include an additional special size Custom size.... When this is selected, two additional controls appear allowing you to set a custom Width and Height for your skin.
Description
When a theme is selected, a description of the theme appears in the panel below the theme list. This description may also include a thumbnail image of the theme decorations.
Backdrop Theme
You can use your own photos to create a backdrop theme. A backdrop theme is a background image that your show plays in front of. To create a backdrop theme, create a single image that is the size you want your show to be. Place this image in the PhotoPulse skins folder. This folder is in the PhotoPulse installation directory (e.g. C:\Program Files\PhotoPulse\skins). Restart PhotoPulse and your backdrop image name will appear in the theme list where you can select it as the theme for your show.
